Description: Limestone ostracon: with remains of five vertical registers of black-painted hieroglyphs, separated by red vertical lines as column-dividers and red horizontal lines between them as section-endings on the recto and a representation, in black-painted outline, of a standing figure in the act of spearing, on the verso. To the right of this figure faint grid lines and a damaged hieroglyphic sign. The text gives part of the text identified as 'Kemit', including section 7 referring to Punt.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (389923) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/389923)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: BS.5623.e (Birch Slip Number not found)
